definition: to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

sentences.english: People thought the banging and popping could help drive away evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲鞭炮齊鳴能驅趕邪氣。

sentences.english: These herding dogs help move and protect the animals.
sentences.chinese: 這些牧羊犬可以驅趕並保護這些牲畜。

sentences.english: pigs being trampled by one another while being unloaded from a truck by a worker with a paddle;
sentences.chinese: 豬從卡車上卸下時，被工人使用棍棒驅趕而相互踐踏。

sentences.english: It helps me face challenges and takes away my worrys.
sentences.chinese: 它幫助我面對挑戰並驅趕煩惱。

sentences.english: The seven silly sheep Silly Sally shooed shilly-shallied south.
sentences.chinese: 那七隻笨羊在笨薩利的驅趕下猶豫不決地向南走。

sentences.english: The wonderful gerben in the street begging, but beggars head drive.
sentences.chinese: 妙戈在街上彈琴乞討，卻被乞丐頭頭驅趕。

sentences.english: On September 9, chile police drives in capital Santiago parader .
sentences.chinese: 9月9日，智利警方在國度名地亞哥驅趕示威者。

sentences.english: I tried to propitiate gods and to dispel demons.
sentences.chinese: 我試著取悅神祇，驅趕惡魔。

sentences.english: The horse kept swinging its tail to drive away the flies.
sentences.chinese: 這匹馬不停地甩尾巴以驅趕蒼蠅。

sentences.english: The vultures try to move in and are prevented by waving sticks and shouts.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷲們再一次試圖靠近但被揮舞的棍棒和吆喝聲驅趕。

sentences.english: In medi times, church bells were often consecrated to ward off evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 中世紀時，教堂的鐘常用於驅趕惡魔。

sentences.english: He said that a sick person could press a coin into a tree and their illness would go away.
sentences.chinese: 他說，人們通過往樹裏戳硬幣來驅趕疾病。

sentences.english: It is a great on-road car as well as being able to drive off the beaten track.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個巨大的硫汽車以及能夠驅趕走老路。

sentences.english: Outlaws stole the cattle and were not averse to killing the men driving them.
sentences.chinese: 歹徒偷牛並樂意殺掉驅趕牛的人。

sentences.english: The horse swithed its tail to drive the flies away.
sentences.chinese: 馬甩動尾巴以驅趕蒼蠅。

sentences.english: After the pilgrim's prayer, they will throw stones at the wall, symbolizing driving devil away.
sentences.chinese: 朝聖者還向向牆壁扔石頭，象徵驅趕魔鬼。

definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
